I was put on this because of a low testosterone count. My levels had adjusted very slightly so far but if you read different articles it is different for everyone. I will follow up on this article in a month after the 90 day cycle that the test are based on is complete.

column2: rberrysr, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug is dangerous, because it makes me drowsy. I applied it in the morning, and nod off during conversations. I have mild sleep apnea and it makes sleeping much more dificult. I took a 100 mg (two tubes daily) of this treatment for 45 days. I stopped and immediately felt and slept better, and eliminated the drowseyness problem the next day. The medicine at this dosage is effective, but don't dare drive while taking it.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 47 year old Caucasian male. I've been on Testim for three months and at two months my Dr "upped" the dosage to two tubes a day instead of one as my levels had not come up yet. My T level on the first test was 158 and the second test was 130 - both before starting Testim. I go back in three months for a follow up and another blood test to check my Testosterone levels. My levels are extremely low for my age, which is why I'm taking it. I have slightly elevated BP (very slight as the Dr put it). As far as ease of use it is easy to put on just a pain to get it all out of that metal tube. If you rub it in (keep rubbing it till your skin "feels dry") It does feel a little "tacky" but a little baby powder fixes that. As far as the smell goes it does have a strong alcohol smell but my wife loves the smell and I've had compliments from other women about how I smell and wanting to know what cologne I was using. Overall I'm still too early in it to really know if it's going to work well for me but will follow up after my next Dr visit and get the results of whether my T levels have come up to normal or not.

column2: Texas Mike, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm 60 years old and was fatigued, in pain in my joints, and losing muscle strength fast.  I used this medication 1 month.  My joint pain vanished.  I put on 3 lbs of muscle mass.  I do 150 pushups/day + curls + 100 situps/day.  I gained flexiblity.  My body was no longer in pain.  Side effects :  skin reaction, redness, that wouldn't go away ; a change in aggressiveness ; trouble sleeping.  No change in sexual performance.  Still ok but not like when I was 30.  Still need occasional Cialis.  I reviewed the clinical trials and I saw no reason to put the medication on the uppper arms except that's where they put it in the clinical trial.  I experimented by putting it on my legs for awhile.  Why not ?  They have skin too.  Didn't seem to matter.  Still the same benefits and side effects.  Testosterone levels in my blood still went up.  Wish they would make a cream versus the alcohol base, however.

column2: kermit kabab, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It is VERY IMPORTANT to read all information.  Ask lots of questions - take the Dr.'s time - he's getting paid! This medication may cause severe physical and emotional effects that are very easy to fix.  I find proper diet and exercise essential.  Unless you are medically unable don't be so lazy.  Low blood sugar can cause emotional roller-coaster effects.  No, you are not dying or facing divorce.  This is not an aphrodisiac.  If you are having emotional or intimacy relationship issues this will not help.  Pray.  Meditate.  Get counseling. Study the Bible.  Whatever...  Never think this or any other substance (herbs, vitamins, capsules, etc.) will may you a better partner.  Don't be that stupid.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Bill, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: About 18 months ago, at the age of 62, I started to have many of the signs of low testosterone - ED, loss of libido, depression and loss of strength. My doctor tested me and my total T was at 304 ng/dl. He put me on 5 gm of Androgel and after 2 months it was 357. He upped it to 7.5 gm and it was at 277 after another 4 months and I still had all the signs of low T. I read that Testim might absorb better and asked him to change me to 10 gm of Testim and he agreed. After 6 months on 10 gm of Testim, my total T was 862, but my free T, DHT and estradiol are a little high. I cut my Testim to 7.5 gm daily a month ago and I still feel great. I will get bloodd work in another month. While on Testim my libido is very good, the ED is almost completely gone and I no longer need Viagra, my depression is gone and my strength has returned and I an using more weight than I have in 5 years. After 7 months on Testim I am very happy with the results so far. The one thing that was better with Androgel is that it was not sticky after it dried, but then it didn't work for me either.
